top_categories.workout_context: Belgian Waffle Ride’s 70% pavement, 30% unroad (dirt, gravel, single-track, sand, rock gardens) demands rapid power changes — surge over obstacles, settle on smoother sections, repeat for hours.
At 120 miles, Belgian Waffle Ride punishes athletes who haven’t trained their body to produce power when glycogen runs low.
Racing Belgian Waffle Ride isn’t just fitness — it’s pacing, fueling, and executing when conditions deteriorate. This workout practices the race itself.
Belgian Waffle Ride rewards athletes who can hold sustained power without blowing up — threshold is the engine that drives everything above Zone 2.
Belgian Waffle Ride’s mixed unroad and pavement and competitive field demand explosive aerobic capacity — the ability to respond to surges without blowing up.
Critical power determines how long you can sustain above-threshold efforts at Belgian Waffle Ride — a higher CP means more time in the red before failure.
Over-unders train the lactate clearance you’ll need at Belgian Waffle Ride when surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding hard.
Short, violent efforts are unavoidable at Belgian Waffle Ride — climbs demanding 2-minute maximal efforts, surges to close gaps, attacks on mixed unroad and pavement.
The G-Spot zone (88–92% FTP) is where you’ll spend the hardest sustained miles of Belgian Waffle Ride. Make this intensity feel like home.
Every session at Belgian Waffle Ride intensity builds on this aerobic foundation — the endurance base is the soil everything else grows in.
Belgian Waffle Ride’s 10,000ft of climbing demands seated and standing versatility — the ability to change climbing style as gradient and fatigue dictate.
At 120 miles, Belgian Waffle Ride rewards a massive aerobic engine. This volume work builds the fat-oxidation capacity that keeps you moving when glycogen runs low.

race_overlay.heat: April in Del Mar, California can bring heat. Complete 3–4 heat exposure sessions in the final 2 weeks before Belgian Waffle Ride. Increase sodium intake 48 hours before race day.
race_overlay.nutrition: Target 60–80g carbs/hour for Belgian Waffle Ride’s 120 miles. Start fueling within the first 30 minutes — early fueling prevents late-race collapse. Bonking at mile 60 is a nutrition failure, not a fitness failure.
race_overlay.terrain: Highly technical terrain at Belgian Waffle Ride demands practice on similar surfaces. Ride mixed unroad and pavement at race-day cadence weekly. Expect: 70% pavement, 30% unroad (dirt, gravel, single-track, sand, rock gardens), water crossings. Practice cornering, descending, and power delivery on unstable surfaces. Dial in tire pressure before race week — 5 PSI wrong costs you 15+ minutes over 120 miles.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on Gravel Specific, Durability, and Race Simulation to prepare you for 120 miles of mixed unroad and pavement in Del Mar, California.
